conclusion: Use the ideal gas law in the form of the combined gas law to solve for the temperature at state B.
At state A: Pressure p1 = 3 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V1 = 1 x 10^-3 m³, Temperature T1 = 27°C = 300.15 K.
At state B: Pressure p2 = 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V2 = 1 x 10^-3 m³, Temperature T2 (to be determined).
Substitute known values into the combined gas law equation.
Simplify the equation: (3 x 10^2) / 300.15 = (1 x 10^2) / T2.
Cross-multiply to solve for T2: 300 x T2 = 300.15 x 100.
The temperature of the gas at state B is -173.1 °C.
